alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Eastern Franklin; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A snow squall will impact portions of eastern Lamoille, northeastern Orange, Caledonia, Orleans, Essex, northeastern Washington and eastern Franklin Counties through 215 PM EST... At 129 PM EST, A snow squall was reported near Charleston, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds 25 mph or greater, and visibility less than a half mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds may blow around unsecured objects. Low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Newport City, St. Johnsbury, Island Pond, Lyndon, Montpelier, Orleans, Derby Center, Charleston, Jay, Calais, Newport Town, Jay In Franklin County, Glover, Albany, Burke, Brunswick, Hyde Park, Troy, Greensboro Bend and Averill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 54 and 55. Interstate 91 between mile markers 110 and 116, near mile marker 118, near mile marker 120, and between mile markers 123 and 177. Interstate 93 between mile markers 1 and 11.
info.instruction: Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you.

area.areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Franklin; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington
